revision.comment: Correct as of match played 27/2/19, vs Atalanta
revision.text:
{{Portuguese name|Fernandes|Ribeiro}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Edimilson Fernandes | image = Edimilson Fernandes.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Fernandes with [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 2016 | fullname = Edimilson Fernandes Ribeiro{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136|title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed|publisher=Premier League|date=2 September 2016|accessdate=2 September 2016}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|4|15|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Sion, Switzerland|Sion]], Switzerland | height = {{height|m=1.90}} | currentclub = [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]]
(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) | clubnumber = 26 | position = [[Midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 2007–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[FC Sion]] | years1 = 2013–2016 | clubs1 = [[FC Sion]] | caps1 = 48 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2016– | clubs2 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps2 = 42 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] (loan) | caps3 = 21 | goals3 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2016– | nationalteam1 = [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2016– | nationalteam2 = [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | pcupdate = 17 February 2019 | ntupdate = 18 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Edimilson Fernandes Ribeiro''' (born 15 April 1996) is a Swiss professional [[football (soccer)|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] for [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] in [[Serie A]], on loan from [[Premier League]] side [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/edimilson-fernandes/298173/|title=Switzerland — E. Fernandes — Profile with news, career statistics and history — Soccerway|website=www.int.soccerway.com|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=29 August 2015}} ==Club career== ===Sion=== Fernandes is a youth exponent from [[FC Sion]]. He made his [[Swiss Super League]] debut on 1 June 2013 against [[FC Zürich]] in 4–2 home win. He started in the first eleven and was substituted after 53 minutes.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2013/06/01/switzerland/super-league/fc-sion/fc-zurich/1293283/|title=FC Sion vs. FC Zürich - 1 June 2013 - Soccerway|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=2015-08-29}} He scored his first senior goal on 1 March 2015 a 2–2 draw at home to [[FC Luzern]]. Fernandes played every minute of Sion's [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League]] campaign before the side was knocked out by [[S.C. Braga|Braga]] in the last 32. In all games he played 65 times for Sion's first team and 41 games for the club's under-21 side. ===West Ham United=== On 25 August 2016, Fernandes signed a four-year deal with English club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] for a fee of ₤5 million.{{Cite web|url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/August/August-25/Hammers-secure-Swiss-star-Fernandes|title=Hammers secure Swiss star Fernandes|date=25 August 2016|website=www.whufc.com|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|access-date=25 August 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160826094825/http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/August/August-25/Hammers-secure-Swiss-star-Fernandes|archivedate=26 August 2016|df=}} He made his West Ham debut on 25 September 2016 in a 3–0 home defeat by [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], coming on as an 82nd-minute substitute for [[Mark Noble]].{{cite web | url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/09/25/england/premier-league/west-ham-united-fc/southampton-fc/2241818/ | title=West Ham 0-3 Southampton | publisher=Soccerway | accessdate=28 October 2016}} On 26 October 2016, Fernandes scored his first goal for West Ham in a 2–1 win against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[EFL Cup]], winning praise from manager [[Slaven Bilić]].{{cite web|url=http://bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37700008|title=West Ham United 2-1 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Spoer|date=26 October 2016|accessdate=27 October 2016}}{{cite web | url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2016/10/27/slaven-bilic-admits-west-hams-edimilson-fernandes-has-surprised/ | title=Slaven Bilic admits West Ham's Edimilson Fernandes has surprised him this season | publisher=www.hitc.com | accessdate=28 October 2016}} ====Loan to Fiorentina==== On 13 August 2018, Fernandes joined Italian side [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] on a one-year loan deal with an option to buy.{{cite web | url = https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/west-ham-youngster-edimilson-fernandes-joins-fiorentina-on-loan-with-option-to-buy-a3910121.html | title = West Ham's Fernandes joins Fiorentina on loan with purchase option | first = James | last = Benge | work = London Evening Standard | date = 13 August 2018 | accessdate = 13 August 2018}} ==International career== Fernandes made his debut for the [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland under-21 team]] in March 2016 in a 1–1 draw with [[England national under-21 football team|England]]. In his second game, on 2 September 2016, he scored his first international goal in a 3–0 win against [[Kazakhstan national under-21 football team|Kazakhstan]] in [[Biel/Bienne]].{{cite web | url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/edimilson-fernandes/298173/ | title=E Fernandes | publisher=Soccerway | accessdate=3 September 2016}}{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/September/2-September/U21-pair-taste-victory | title=U21 pair taste victory | publisher=www.whufc.com | accessdate=3 September 2016}} In November 2016, Fernandes received his first call-up to the senior [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] squad for a match against the [[Faroe Islands national football team|Faroe Islands]].{{cite news |url=http://www.lematin.ch/sports/football/lacroix-edimilson-fernandes/story/29089329 |title=Football Avec Lacroix et Edimilson Fernandes |publisher=lematin.ch |date=4 November 2016 |accessdate=7 November 2016}} He made his senior debut against them, coming off the bench in the 69th minute. ==Personal life== Fernandes was born in [[Sion, Switzerland]], of Portuguese and Cape Verdean descent.{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/News/Articles/2016/August/26-August/Ten-Fast-Facts-Edimilson-Fernandes | title=Ten Fast Facts — Edimilson Fernandes | publisher=www.whufc.com | accessdate=27 August 2016}} He is the cousin of Swiss international footballer [[Gelson Fernandes]], [[Manuel Fernandes (footballer, born 1986)|Manuel Fernandes]] and ex-[[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] midfielder [[Cabral (footballer)|Cabral]]. ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 27 February 2019}}{{cite web|title=E. FERNANDES|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/edimilson-fernandes/298173/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=4 September 2016}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2|Club
